oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Oklahoma Roundup Rehearsal - 1946-08-31 - KOMA - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance from the Oklahoma Roundup radio program, staff includes Hiram Higsby (master of ceremonies, writer), Allan Page (announcer, director), Kenyon Brown (producer). Performances feature Chuck Davis (performer), the Homegrown Trio (performers), Hiram Higsby (performer), Mary Lou (performers), and the The Prairie Songbirds (performers) on August 31, 1946 on radio station KOMA (Oklahoma City, Okla).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Chuck Davis; Homegrown Trio; Hiram Higsby; Mary Lou; Prairie Songbirds
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Opening statement -- Opening theme -- Hiram Higsby introduces the show -- Allan Page introduces Hiram Higsby -- Hiram Higsby introduces Chuck Davis -- Bill Bailey Won’t You Please Come Home (Chuc(0:00) Opening statements and theme / (1:33) Hiram Higsby introduces Chuck Davis / (1:42) Chuck Davis performs "Bill Bailey Won’t You Please Come Home" / (2:40) Hiram Higsby tells a joke / (3:10) The Homegrown Trio performs "Hit The Trail" / (4:50) Allan Page and Hiram Higsby tell a joke / (5:45) Hiram Higsby performs "I’d Love To Be A Cowboy But I’m Afraid Of Cows" / (7:53) Hiram Higsby tells a joke / (8:30) Mary Lou performs "Bury Me Beneath The Willow" / (11:27) Allan Page and Hiram Higsby tell a joke / (12:42) The Prairie Songbirds perform "Tweedle-O-Twill"k Davis) -- Hiram Higsby tells a joke -- Hit The Trail (Homegrown Trio) -- Allan Page and Hiram Higsby tell a joke -- I’d Love To Be A Cowboy But I’m Afraid Of Cows (Hiram Higsby) -- Hiram Higsby tells a joke -- Bury Me Beneath The Willow (Mary Lou) -- Allan Page and Hiram Higsby tell a joke -- Tweedle-O-Twill (Prairie Songbirds)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Oklahoma Roundup; KOMA (Radio station : Oklahoma City, Okla.); CBS Inc.; Davis, Chuck; Higsby, Hiram, 1909-1975;
